title: Unused shadowing variable should suggest mutating the shadowed variable instead

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=4266164d35907aecdf2884e9f588b05e

```rust
let x = 5;
if maybe() {
    let x = 10;
}
used(x);
```

The current output is:

```
warning: unused variable: `x`
 --> src/main.rs:7:13
  |
7 |         let x = 10;
  |             ^ help: if this is intentional, prefix it with an underscore: `_x`
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unused_variables)]` on by default
```

Ideally, the compiler should notice that `x` shadows the outer binding, and suggest removing the `let` instead (and adding `mut`, if required).

<!--
If the problem is not self-explanatory, please provide a rationale for the
change.
-->

This is likely the cause of this user's mistake: https://www.reddit.com/r/rust/comments/r5w7t0/why_does_this_not_work_completely_new_to_rust

<!--
If dramatically different output is caused by small changes, consider also
adding them here.

If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions. The output might also be
different depending on the Edition.
-->

If the outer binding is `mut`, the compiler even suggests removing the `mut` and silencing the unused warning, rather than making it actually assign to the outer binding.

```
warning: unused variable: `x`
 --> src/lib.rs:7:13
  |
7 |         let x = 10;
  |             ^ help: if this is intentional, prefix it with an underscore: `_x`
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unused_variables)]` on by default

warning: variable does not need to be mutable
 --> src/lib.rs:5:9
  |
5 |     let mut x = 5;
  |         ----^
  |         |
  |         help: remove this `mut`
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unused_mut)]` on by default
```
